member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Auth.SameSchoolHandler
member.summary: Validates that the schoolId contained in the JWT matches the one in the URL (works with both MVC filters and endpoint routing).

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Auth.SameSchoolRequirement
member.summary: Requirement: the user must belong to the same school as in the route.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.#ctor(ApplicationDbContext,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.UserManager{DriveFlow_CRM_API.Models.ApplicationUser},Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.RoleManager{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.IdentityRole})
member.summary: Constructor invoked per request by DI.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.CreateInstructorAsync(System.Int32,DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.InstructorCreateDto)
member.summary: Creates a new instructor and links them to the selected teaching categories.
member.response: Validation failed (password strength, duplicate e-mail, invalid IDs).
Authenticated user does not belong to the specified school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.CreateStudentAsync(System.Int32,DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.StudentCreateDto)
member.summary: Creates a new Student together with the related File and Payment records. Payment and StudentFile.
member.response: Validation failed (duplicate CNP, negative sessions, etc.).
Authenticated user does not belong to the specified school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.GetUserAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a single user (Student or Instructor). For instructors the response also includes all teaching categories.
member.param: The string ID of the user (exact value returned by the list-users endpoint).
member.response: Invalid ID supplied or user has an unsupported role.
Authenticated admin does not belong to the specified school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.GetUsersAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Lists every user (Student or Instructor) that belongs to the given school.
member.response: Array with all users in the school.
Authenticated admin does not belong to the specified school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.GetUsersByTypeAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns all users of the specified type (Student or Instructor) that belong to the given school.
member.param: Required role name: Instructor or Student.
member.response: Array of users matching the requested role.
Authenticated admin does not belong to the specified school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.UpdateStudentAsync(System.Int32,System.String,DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.UpdateStudentDto)
member.summary: Updates basic data for an existing student. If password is supplied, it is reset via Identity.
member.param: Student’s GUID string from the route.
member.response: Student belongs to a different school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.UpdateInstructorAsync(System.Int32,System.String,DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.UpdateInstructorDto)
member.summary: Updates an instructor’s personal data and replaces their teaching-category list.
member.remarks:
Sample request body
```json { "firstName": "Vasile", "lastName": "Alexandru", "email": "andrei.popescu@school.ro", "phone": "0723456789", "password": "*Parola123", "teachingCategoryIds": [1] } ``` Any scalar field you omit (e.g. phone) is left unchanged. teachingCategoryIds is a definitive list: the existing links are fully replaced.
member.param: Instructor’s GUID string from the route.
member.response: Instructor belongs to a different school.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Controllers.SchoolAdminController.DeleteUserAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a student or instructor that belongs to the specified school. SchoolAdmin accounts cannot be removed.
member.param: User GUID returned by the list-users endpoint.
member.response: Cannot delete SchoolAdmin or validation failed.
User belongs to a different school.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.ITokenGenerator
member.summary: Defines a component that can generate a signed security token (typically a JWT) for an .
member.remarks: Implementations such as JwtAccessTokenGenerator or JwtRefreshTokenGenerator decide how the token is built, what claims are included, and how it is cryptographically signed.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.ITokenGenerator.GenerateToken(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Identity.IdentityUser,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a token that represents .
member.param: Identity account for which the token is issued.
Roles assigned to the user and embedded as claims.
Optional school identifier to include as a custom claim (use 0 if n/a).
member.returns: The serialized token string (e.g., compact JWT).

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.JwtAccessTokenGenerator
T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.JwtRefreshTokenGenerator
member.summary: Generates signed JWT refresh-tokens for ASP.NET Core Identity users.

list.item: The signing key is read from the JWT_KEY environment variable, or Jwt:Key in appsettings.json.
Jwt:Issuer, Jwt:Audience and a positive integer Jwt:RefreshExpiresDays are required.
The token includes only sub, jti and a typ=refresh claim.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.JwtRefreshTokenGenerator.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Creates the generator and validates configuration.
member.exception: Thrown when any mandatory JWT setting is missing or invalid.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenType
member.summary: Distinguishes between the two JWT flavours issued by the API.

member.name: F:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenType.Access
member.summary: Short-lived token placed in the Authorization header.

member.name: F:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenType.Refresh
member.summary: Long-lived token used to obtain a fresh token.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenGeneratorFactory
member.summary: Factory that creates a concrete for the requested .

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenGeneratorFactory.Create(DriveFlow_CRM_API.Authentication.Tokens.TokenType,System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Returns an implementation suited to .
member.param: Kind of token to generate ( or ).
– used to resolve configuration and the claim handlers (Chain of Responsibility) registered in DI.
member.exception: Thrown if an unrecognised is supplied.

member.summary: Contract for persisting and validating refresh-tokens that belong to an .

member.param: The account that owns the token.

member.summary: Validates that matches the stored value and is not expired.

member.returns: if the token matches and is still valid.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Models.ApplicationUser
member.summary: Platform user. Identity roles (SuperAdmin, SchoolAdmin, Instructor, Student) decide at runtime what operations are allowed, but the database schema remains a single table.
member.remarks:
• Optional FK — only school-level roles belong to a school.
• One-to-many toward , , and the bridge entity .
• Deleting the user sets those FKs to null (DeleteBehavior.SetNull in OnModelCreating).

member.summary: User’s given name.

member.summary: User’s family name.

member.summary: Join-entity that links an (student or instructor) to a .

• Deleting the teaching category cascades as well.
• No additional columns, just the two foreign keys.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Models.File
member.summary: File entity that stores any document uploaded to the platform: invoices, lesson sheets, vehicle papers, etc.
member.remarks:
• One-to-one with via PaymentId; deleting this file cascades to its payment.
• One-to-many with ; deleting the file cascades to its appointments.
• Optional many-to-one toward , , and an acting as instructor.
• Mandatory many-to-one toward a student ().
• Other optional links are set to null when the related entity is deleted.

• One-to-one with (receipt / invoice).
• is the FK; deleting the parent File cascades and deletes this Payment.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.Models.TeachingCategory
member.summary: A teaching category offered by an (e.g. “B Manual”).
member.remarks:
• FK is **required**; deleting the school cascades.
• FK is **optional**; deleting the licence sets it to null.
• Deleting a category cascades to the join-table but does not delete files (their FK is set to null).
• is unique inside one school.

member.name: T:DriveFlow_CRM_API.ApplicationDbContextFactory
member.summary: Design-time factory for used by EF Core tooling (dotnet ef migrations add, dotnet ef database update). Implementing prevents the “Unable to create a DbContext” error by telling EF Core exactly how to build the context when the application entry point is not executed.

item.description: Reads the JawsDB connection URI from the environment variable JAWSDB_URL.
Converts that URI into a regular MySQL connection string and configures Pomelo via , letting pick the correct dialect.
Throws if JAWSDB_URL is missing so design-time operations fail fast.

member.name: M:DriveFlow_CRM_API.ApplicationDbContextFactory.CreateDbContext(System.String[])
member.exception: Thrown when JAWSDB_URL is not defined.

member.summary: Constructor injected by the framework with request‑scoped services.

member.name: M:AuthController.LoginAsync(LoginDto)
member.summary: Authenticates a user and returns an access-token plus a refresh-token.
member.remarks:
Secret key is read from JWT_KEY (env) or Jwt:Key (appsettings).
Sample request body:
```json { "email": "student@test.com", "password": "Student231!" } ```
member.response: Login successful – returns tokens and user metadata.

member.name: M:AuthController.RefreshAsync(RefreshDto)
member.summary: Exchanges a valid refresh‑token for a new access‑token.
member.response: Refresh‑token invalid or user no longer exists.

member.name: T:LoginDto
member.summary: DTO used for login credentials.

member.name: M:LoginDto.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: DTO used for login credentials.

member.name: P:LoginDto.Email
member.summary: E‑mail address (UserName in Identity).

member.name: P:LoginDto.Password
member.summary: Account password in plain text.

member.name: T:RefreshDto
member.summary: DTO used to request a new access‑token using a refresh‑token.

member.name: M:RefreshDto.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: DTO used to request a new access‑token using a refresh‑token.

member.name: P:RefreshDto.RefreshToken
member.summary: The previously issued refresh‑token.
